parts.title: Part 1 - CSS Review and Text Alignment
parts.description: Review CSS syntax and learn about text alignment properties. Understand how to align text left, right, center, and use start/end values for different languages and text directions.
keyConcepts: Text alignment properties (left, right, center, start, end)
Applying text-align to sections and images

question2.text: Which CSS property is used to center text?

question3.text: What is the purpose of using 'text-align: start' instead of 'text-align: left'?

options.text: It adapts to the text direction (LTR or RTL)

parts.title: Part 2 - Colors in CSS
parts.description: Learn different ways to define colors in CSS including named colors, RGB values, hex codes, opacity, and gradients. Understand color models and how to create beautiful color schemes.
keyConcepts: RGB values (0-255 for red, green, blue)

question1.text: Which of the following is a valid way to specify color in CSS?

question2.text: What does the 'A' in RGBA stand for?

parts.title: Part 3 - Spacing with Margin and Padding
parts.description: Master spacing in CSS by learning the difference between margin and padding. Understand user agent stylesheets, CSS resets, and how to center elements horizontally using margin auto.
keyConcepts: Margin creates space outside an element
Padding creates space inside an element
CSS reset to remove default browser styles

question1.text: What is the difference between margin and padding?

options.text: Margin is inside, padding is outside
Margin is outside, padding is inside
Margin is for text, padding is for images

question2.text: How do you center an element horizontally using margin?

question3.text: What does the CSS reset (* { margin: 0; padding: 0; }) do?

options.text: Removes default browser spacing from all elements

parts.title: Part 4 - IDs and Classes
parts.videoTitle: Using IDs and Classes for Styling
parts.description: Learn how to target specific elements using IDs and classes. Understand when to use IDs versus classes, naming conventions, and how to create more specific CSS selectors for better control.
keyConcepts: ID attribute for unique elements (# selector)
Class attribute for multiple elements (. selector)
Naming rules for IDs and classes

question1.text: How do you select an element with id='header' in CSS?

question2.text: What is the main difference between IDs and classes?

options.text: IDs can only be used once per page, classes can be used multiple times
Classes can only be used once, IDs can be used multiple times
IDs are for images, classes are for text
